attributes.action: Ban ministers & MPs from wearing uniforms of organisations they don't work for.
attributes.additional_details:
Government ministers and the prime minister seem obsessed with posing in staff work uniforms for the cameras. This promotes and reward businesses who host their visits and is a form of government supported advertising for the businesses. It unfairly rewards those businesses who support the political aims of the MP or minister. Also it is intended to create an impression of ministers and MPs 'hard at work' when in fact they are promoting themselves.
This type of 'advertising propaganda' is wrong.
attributes.background: Block MPs and ministers from wearing logos and uniforms of companies and organisations they are not employed by.

rejection.details: Decisions on what clothing to wear when not on the Parliamentary Estate are personal matters for individual MPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.
